results.title: Ordinary extraordinary stories
results.brief_description: Ordinary Extraordinary stories features a selection of digital stories produced as part of ACMI digital storytelling public workshop program. This collection celebrates the extraordinary stories of ordinary people. The stories are as diverse as the people who have created them

results.title: A Writer's legacy
results.brief_description: Heather’s father believed in his daughter as a writer even when she did not believe in herself. He left her letters and memorabilia but the real legacy her father left her was the love of writing.
results.description: Heather’s father believed in his daughter as a writer even when she did not believe in herself. He left her letters and memorabilia but the real legacy her father left her was the love of writing.

results.title: Our wonderful pa
results.brief_description: Lisa’s father was born in 1932 and died in 2003 of prostate cancer. This story is a tribute to a much-loved father and grandfather.

results.title: My grandfather, the spy
results.brief_description: It was wartime when Edwina’s grandfather met her grandmother. He had a toothache and met his wife to be at the front door. Her father was the local dentist. Edwina tells her grandfather’s extraordinary life story.

results.title: The Little Frenchman
results.brief_description: Roger was a widower with no living relatives or close friends. His life experiences placed him in both world wars and post war migration. This is his story.

results.title: The Goodfather
results.brief_description: Joe’s dad migrated to Australia when he was a young boy. His achievements in life are what Joe celebrates in this moving tribute to his dad.

results.title: A Family story
results.brief_description: As a small child living in London Daphne witnessed the Blitz. This story is about Daphne’s life growing up in London in WW2 and her migration and settlement in Australia.

results.title: Camping legends
results.brief_description: In 1936 Fiona’s grandparents drove the inland route from Lithgow to Ayr in far North Queensland in a 1927 dodge. The journey was legendary.

results.title: Orchestra!
results.creator_credit: Initial (GB), Jonathan Hewes and Declan Lowney
results.brief_description: This series is an entertaining and informative introduction to the symphony orchestra. Featuring Maestro George Solti and the musical talent and humour of Dudley Moore, the three volumes trace the development of the various sections of the orchestra from the time of Bach and Handel to today. The theme of the four parts of the orchestra is established by breaking down a piece of music into its four constituent parts - strings, brass, percussion and woodwind.
results.description: This series is an entertaining and informative introduction to the symphony orchestra. Featuring Maestro George Solti and the musical talent and humour of Dudley Moore, the three volumes trace the development of the various sections of the orchestra from the time of Bach and Handel to today. The theme of the four parts of the orchestra is established by breaking down a piece of music into its four constituent parts - strings, brass, percussion and woodwind.
description_for_label: This series is an entertaining and informative introduction to the symphony orchestra. Featuring Maestro George Solti and the musical talent and humour of Dudley Moore, the three volumes trace the development of the various sections of the orchestra from the time of Bach and Handel to today. The theme of the four parts of the orchestra is established by breaking down a piece of music into its four constituent parts - strings, brass, percussion and woodwind.

results.title: The Making of 'Orchestra!': Piano. The conductor
results.creator_credit: Declan Lowney, Jonathan Lewes and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series explores the making of the series. It examines the role of the piano as a solo instrument within an orchestra and the role of the conductor from learning the score through interpretation, the metronome and rehearsal technique.
